request_pathways.name: Patient Request for Access to Information form
Mail to Philadelphia FIGHT Privacy Officer, 1233 Locust St. 5th Floor, Philadelphia PA 19107
In person at any Philadelphia FIGHT Health Center

forms.document_type: third-party authorization for use and disclosure form

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Dedicated single-page PDF form titled 'Patient Request for Access to Information' for patients to request their own records, separate from a third-party authorization form.

red_flags: No mention of patient's right to appeal a denial of access, as required by HIPAA § 164.524(d)(4)
Fee language describes four cost categories without providing amounts or estimates; costs billed after fulfillment with no advance estimate mechanism
bright_spots: Dedicated patient access form separate from third-party authorization — a structural best practice
Email submission option (privacy@fight.org) in addition to fax, mail, and in-person
Electronic format option with open 'Specify' field respecting patient's right to choose format
Bilingual availability (English and Spanish) on Forms and Consents page
Adolescent self-access at age 13+ reflecting Pennsylvania minor consent law
Sensitive information opt-out on third-party form with granular categories relevant to patient population

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find via basic navigation (About → Forms and Consents) or site-specific web search; descriptive link text and direct PDF download links, though not prominently featured on the homepage.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Digitally-created PDF with text layer but zero fillable fields, requiring print-and-handwrite or PDF annotation workarounds; fax and email submission channels available.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized single-page form with logical flow and checkbox-based options; minor issues include dense introductory paragraph with inline legal language and lack of explicit section headers.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 5: Process designed around patient self-access as a first-class use case with a dedicated form clearly distinct from third-party release, offering format and delivery choices and multiple submission channels.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization or in-person requirements; response timeline stated correctly; minor ambiguities in fee language (no specific amounts) and omission of denial appeal rights, but nothing that materially impedes patient access.

overall.summary: Philadelphia FIGHT demonstrates best-practice pathway differentiation with a dedicated patient access form and multiple submission channels including email, but the lack of fillable PDF fields and vague fee disclosures prevent a top-tier rating.
